basics.name: Jerry Batorski
basics.label: Staff Software Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced Frontend Staff Engineer passionate about hands on development, building high quality, scalable web applications, and contributing to strong engineering cultures. Seeking an implementation focused role leveraging extensive experience in modern frontend technologies and a commitment to technical excellence.

work.name: Grubhub
highlights: Authored clean, consistent, extensible, and maintainable React code, focusing on principles like separating presentation, business, and state logic to manage complexity effectively.
Leveraged component libraries and modern styling solutions (Styled Components) to accelerate development, ensure UI consistency, and improve code maintainability.
Implemented comprehensive testing strategies (unit, integration, E2E) using Jest/RTL/TestCafe, balancing coverage, confidence, and long term maintainability.
Championed robust engineering practices through thorough code reviews, proactive technical debt management, and fostering a culture of quality and shared ownership.
Led and implemented observability initiatives using Datadog (SLOs, monitors, dashboards), improving system visibility and establishing on-call/alert triage processes for frontend teams.

Rapidly assimilated complex codebases and diverse business domains (Restaurant, Delivery, Customer Support, Corporate, Diner) to deliver impactful solutions across large scale projects, such as catering and scheduled team order types.
Collaborated effectively with product, design, and engineering stakeholders to define project scope, identify technical requirements, and ensure successful feature delivery.

Actively evangelized and integrated AI development tools (Copilot, Gemini, Claude, RooCode) to enhance team productivity, streamline workflows (Jira story generation, code suggestions, AI PR reviews leveraging team defined coding standards), and foster adoption of modern development aids.
Mentored engineers in React, TypeScript, testing, and clean code principles, contributing to team skill development.

work.name: CDK Global
highlights: Pivotal role in maturing from a passionate coder to a software engineer, embracing and championing agile methodologies, comprehensive testing (unit, integration, E2E), CI/CD, and clean code principles.
Developed key features for an inventory management product using AngularJS, employing Jasmine for unit testing and Selenium for E2E testing within a Grunt based build process.

Spearheaded the creation and adoption of the team's CI/CD pipeline using Git, Bamboo, Grunt, Jasmine/Karma, ESLint, Sonar, and SauceLabs, automating quality gates for code reviews, static analysis, and multi level testing.
Designed and implemented a comprehensive testing strategy, integrating unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to significantly improve deployment confidence and code quality.
Actively practiced and promoted Agile/Scrum, mentored junior Product Owners, and facilitated knowledge sharing among Scrum Masters to enhance team effectiveness.
Provided technical mentorship to developers on unit testing, maintainable code, software design, and advanced troubleshooting techniques.

work.name: Answers Media
highlights: Gained extensive full-stack development experience (.NET, C#, SQL Server, JS/jQuery), taking ownership of features from concept to delivery and discovering a primary passion for frontend development.

Engineered a real time Q&A application using AngularJS and SignalR with a SQL Server backplane, enabling live video, chat, and data synchronization for thousands of concurrent users across load balanced servers.
Developed a user friendly admin interface for a Learning Management System using ASP.NET MVC, Razor Views, jQuery, and AJAX, simplifying content management for non technical users.
Extended and customized an in-house CMS (C#, .NET 4.5, Entity Framework, SQL Server, MVC4), building reusable widgets and an interactive HTML template editor with live configuration.
Independently analyzed complex requirements, architected solutions, and delivered end-to-end features, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

work.name: Chicago Public Schools
highlights: Demonstrated rapid learning and initiative by transitioning from payroll analysis to IT, self-teaching .NET and SQL to build impactful applications addressing critical business needs.
Co-developed a high-impact ASP.NET Online Recruiting System, processing 30,000+ applications and 3,200+ hires within six months of launch, significantly streamlining HR workflows.

Initiated and implemented critical internal system upgrades, including introducing TFS for source control, establishing branching/deployment strategies, upgrading systems to .NET 4, and integrating Log4Net for robust logging.
As a Payroll Analyst, developed SQL audit reports and automated tooling for processing payroll for 55k+ employees, ensuring accuracy and compliance with complex union rules and pension calculations.
Designed and developed various ASP.NET applications by directly collaborating with stakeholders to understand business requirements and user workflows.
